title: Provides access to redacted copies of death certificates
summary: Provides access to copies of death certificates with identifying information redacted.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1224

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. BING, REILLY, ROSENTHAL, CLARK, SPANO, CASTRO --
         Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. BOYLAND,  COOK,  GABRYSZAK,  J. RIVERA,
         TITONE,  WEISENBERG  --  read  once  and  referred to the Committee on
         Health

       AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to  providing  copies
         of redacted death certificates

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph (g) of subdivision  1  of  section  4174  of  the
    2  public  health  law,  as  amended by chapter 396 of the laws of 1989, is
    3  amended and a new paragraph (h) is added to read as follows:
    4    (g) upon request of a  board  of  elections,  issue  certification  of
    5  death[.]; AND
    6    (H)  UPON  REQUEST, AND AT A FEE TO BE DETERMINED BY THE COMMISSIONER,
    7  FURNISH COPIES OF REDACTED DEATH CERTIFICATES WITH THE FOLLOWING  INFOR-
    8  MATION OMITTED: THE NAME, NUMBER AND STREET OF RESIDENCE, SOCIAL SECURI-
    9  TY NUMBER, MEDICAL RECORDS NUMBER AND DATE OF BIRTH OF THE DECEDENT, AND
   10  THE  NAMES  OF  THE  DECEDENT'S  MOTHER,  FATHER  AND  SURVIVING SPOUSE,
   11  PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT THE REDACTED CERTIFICATE SHALL  REFLECT  WHETHER
   12  OR NOT THE DECEDENT HAD A SPOUSE.
   13    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.




        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00635-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to providing copies of redacted death certificates
